items.label: def-mdlgt-state-space
items.title: MDLGT State Space with Center-of-Mass Constraint
items.content:
63: :label: def-mdlgt-state-space
64: 
65: The state of the MDLGT system is a pair $\mathcal{S} = (\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U})$ living in the constrained product space:
66: 
67: $$
68: \Sigma_N = \left\{(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U}) \in (\mathbb{R}^4)^N \times (\text{SU}(N_c))^{E_N(\mathbf{x})} : \sum_{i=1}^N x_i = 0\right\}
69: 
70: $$
71: 
72: where:
73: 
74: - **Nodes (Lattice Sites)**: $\mathbf{x} = (x_1, \ldots, x_N)$ with each $x_i \in \mathbb{R}^4$ representing a position in Euclidean spacetime, subject to the **center-of-mass constraint**:
75: 
76: $$
77: \sum_{i=1}^N x_i = 0
78: 
79: $$
80: 
81: - **Graph Construction**: $\mathcal{G}(\mathbf{x})$ is the **Delaunay triangulation** of the point set $\{x_1, \ldots, x_N\}$ in $\mathbb{R}^4$, producing a simplicial complex of 4-simplices with edge set $E_N(\mathbf{x})$

items.label: def-node-hamiltonian
items.title: Node Hamiltonian (Translation-Invariant)
items.content:
178: :label: def-node-hamiltonian
179: 
180: The node Hamiltonian is defined in terms of **relative coordinates only**:
181: 
182: $$
183: H_{\text{nodes}}(\mathbf{x}) = \sum_{i<j} V_{\text{pair}}(\|x_i - x_j\|)
184: 
185: $$
186: 
187: where $V_{\text{pair}}(r)$ is a pairwise potential with the following properties:
188: 1. **Repulsion at short range**: $V_{\text{pair}}(r) \to +\infty$ as $r \to 0$
189: 2. **Confinement at long range**: $V_{\text{pair}}(r) \to +\infty$ as $r \to \infty$
190: 3. **Bounded gradient on hard-core region**: $\sup_{r \geq r_{\min}} |V_{\text{pair}}'(r)| < \infty$ for any $r_{\min} > 0$
191: 4. **Unique minimum**: $V_{\text{pair}}(r)$ has a unique minimum at $r = r_0 > 0$
192: 
193: :::{note} Relaxed Gradient Requirement
194: Property 3 has been **relaxed from global boundedness** to boundedness on $[r_{\min}, \infty)$ for any $r_{\min} > 0$. This relaxation is necessary because no $C^1$ function can simultaneously:
195: - Diverge to $+\infty$ as $r \to 0$ (Property 1)
196: - Have globally bounded derivative

items.label: def-gauge-hamiltonian
items.title: Gauge Hamiltonian
items.content:
248: :label: def-gauge-hamiltonian
249: 
250: The gauge Hamiltonian is the standard Wilson plaquette action summed over the **2-faces of the Delaunay triangulation**:
251: 
252: $$
253: H_{\text{gauge}}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U}) = \beta_{\text{gauge}} \sum_{\Delta \in \text{Plaq}(\mathbf{x})} \left(1 - \frac{1}{N_c}\text{Re}\,\text{Tr}(U_{\Delta})\right)
254: 
255: $$
256: 
257: where:
258: - $\beta_{\text{gauge}} > 0$ is the inverse coupling constant
259: - $\text{Plaq}(\mathbf{x})$ denotes the set of **oriented 2-simplices** (triangular plaquettes) in the Delaunay triangulation of $\mathbf{x}$
260: - For a triangular 2-face $\Delta = (i, j, k)$ with ordered vertices, the Wilson loop is:
261: 
262: $$
263: U_{\Delta} = U_{ij}U_{jk}U_{ki}
264: 
265: $$

items.label: def-mdlgt-dynamics
items.title: MDLGT Dynamics with Constraint
items.content:
311: :label: def-mdlgt-dynamics
312: 
313: The system evolves via a two-step update procedure:
314: 
315: **Step A (Node Update - Constrained Langevin):**
316: 
317: For each node $i = 1, \ldots, N$, the dynamics evolve on the constrained manifold $\sum_i x_i = 0$ via:
318: 
319: $$
320: dx_i = -\left[\mathbb{P}_{\perp}\nabla_{x_i} H(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U})\right]\, dt + \sqrt{2T}\, \left[\mathbb{P}_{\perp} dW\right]_i
321: 
322: $$
323: 
324: where:
325: - $dW = (dW_1, \ldots, dW_N)$ with each $dW_i$ an independent 4-dimensional Brownian motion
326: - $T > 0$ is the temperature
327: - $\mathbb{P}_{\perp}$ is the orthogonal projection onto the tangent space of the constraint manifold, acting component-wise:
328: 
329: $$
330: \left[\mathbb{P}_{\perp} v\right]_i = v_i - \frac{1}{N}\sum_{j=1}^N v_j
331: 
332: $$
333: 
334: The projection is applied to both the drift and diffusion terms, ensuring $\sum_i dx_i = 0$ for all times, preserving the constraint.
335: 
336: **Step B (Link Update - Heat Bath):**
337: 
338: For fixed node positions $\mathbf{x}$, each link $U_{ij}$ on the current graph $\mathcal{G}(\mathbf{x})$ is resampled from its conditional Boltzmann distribution:
339: 
340: $$
341: P(U_{ij} \mid \text{all other links}) \propto \exp\left(-\frac{1}{T} H_{\text{gauge}}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U})\right)
342: $$

items.label: def-mdlgt-generator
items.title: MDLGT Generator
items.content:
366: :label: def-mdlgt-generator
367: 
368: The infinitesimal generator of the full MDLGT process acting on test functions $f: \Sigma_N \to \mathbb{R}$ is:
369: 
370: $$
371: \mathcal{L} f = \mathcal{L}_{\text{nodes}} f + \mathcal{L}_{\text{links}} f
372: 
373: $$
374: 
375: where:
376: 
377: $$
378: \mathcal{L}_{\text{nodes}} f = -\sum_i \mathbb{P}_{\perp}\nabla_{x_i} H \cdot \nabla_{x_i} f + T\sum_i \text{tr}(\mathbb{P}_{\perp} \nabla_{x_i}^2 f)
379: 
380: $$
